00014 // .NAME vtkCollisionDetectionFilter - performs collision determination between two polyhedral surfaces
00015 // .SECTION Description
00016 // vtkCollisionDetectionFilter performs collision determination between two polyhedral surfaces using
00017 // two instances of vtkOBBTree. Set the polydata inputs, the tolerance and transforms or matrices. If 
00018 // CollisionMode is set to AllContacts, the Contacts output will be lines of contact.
00019 // If CollisionMode is FirstContact or HalfContacts then the Contacts output will be vertices.  
00020 // See below for an explanation of these options.
00021 //
00022 // This class can be used to clip one polydata surface with another, using the Contacts output as a loop
00023 // set in vtkSelectPolyData
00024 
00025 // .SECTION Caveats
00026 // Currently only triangles are processed. Use vtkTriangleFilter to
00027 // convert any strips or polygons to triangles.
00028 
00029 // .SECTION Thanks
00030 // Goodwin Lawlor <goodwin.lawlor@ucd.ie>, University College Dublin, who wrote this class.
00031 // Thanks to Peter C. Everett <pce@world.std.com> for vtkOBBTree::IntersectWithOBBTree() in particular,
00032 // and all those who contributed to vtkOBBTree in general.
00033 
00034 
00035 // .SECTION See Also
00036 // vtkTriangleFilter, vtkSelectPolyData, vtkOBBTree
00037 
00038 #ifndef __vtkCollisionDetectionFilter_h
00039 #define __vtkCollisionDetectionFilter_h
00040 
00041 #include "vtkPolyDataAlgorithm.h"
00042 #include "vtkBioengConfigure.h" // Include configuration header.
00043 
00044 #include "vtkLinearTransform.h"
00045 #include "vtkIdTypeArray.h"
00046 #include "vtkFieldData.h"
00047 
00048 class vtkOBBTree;
00049 class vtkPolyData;
00050 class vtkPoints;
00051 class vtkMatrix4x4;
00052 
00053 // If you are compiling this class as an addition to VTK/Graphics change VTK_BIOENG_EXPORTS
00054 // to VTK_GRAPHICS_EXPORT on the next line and delete 
00055 // "#include "vtkBioengConfigure.h" // Include configuration header." above.
00056 
00057 class VTK_BIOENG_EXPORT vtkCollisionDetectionFilter : public vtkPolyDataAlgorithm
00058 {
00059 public:
00060   vtkTypeRevisionMacro(vtkCollisionDetectionFilter, vtkPolyDataAlgorithm);
00061   void PrintSelf(ostream& os, vtkIndent indent);
00062 
00063 //BTX
00064   enum CollisionModes
00065   {
00066     VTK_ALL_CONTACTS = 0,
00067     VTK_FIRST_CONTACT = 1,
00068     VTK_HALF_CONTACTS = 2 
00069   };
00070 //ETX
00071 
00072   // Description:
00073   // Set the collision mode to VTK_ALL_CONTACTS to find all the contacting cell pairs with
00074   // two points per collision, or VTK_HALF_CONTACTS to find all the contacting cell pairs
00075   // with one point per collision, or VTK_FIRST_CONTACT to quickly find the first contact
00076   // point.
00077   vtkSetClampMacro(CollisionMode,int,VTK_ALL_CONTACTS,VTK_HALF_CONTACTS);
00078   vtkGetMacro(CollisionMode,int);
00079   void SetCollisionModeToAllContacts() {this->SetCollisionMode(VTK_ALL_CONTACTS);};
00080   void SetCollisionModeToFirstContact() {this->SetCollisionMode(VTK_FIRST_CONTACT);};
00081   void SetCollisionModeToHalfContacts() {this->SetCollisionMode(VTK_HALF_CONTACTS);};
00082   const char *GetCollisionModeAsString();
00083 
00084   // Description:
00085   // Constructs with initial values.
00086   static vtkCollisionDetectionFilter *New();
00087 
00088   // Description:
00089   // Intersect two polygons, return x1 and x2 as the twp points of intersection. If
00090   // CollisionMode = VTK_ALL_CONTACTS, both contact points are found. If 
00091   // CollisionMode = VTK_FIRST_CONTACT or VTK_HALF_CONTACTS, only
00092   // one contact point is found.
00093   int IntersectPolygonWithPolygon(int npts, double *pts, double bounds[6],
00094                                             int npts2, double *pts2, 
00095                                             double bounds2[6], double tol2,
00096                                             double x1[2], double x2[3],
00097                                             int CollisionMode);
00098   
00099   // Description:
00100   // Set and Get the input vtk polydata models
00101     void SetInput(int i, vtkPolyData *model);
00102     vtkPolyData *GetInput(int i);
00103 
00104       
00105   // Description:
00106   // Get an array of the contacting cells. This is a convenience method to access 
00107   // the "ContactCells" field array in outputs 0 and 1. These arrays index contacting
00108   // cells (eg) index 50 of array 0 points to a cell (triangle) which contacts/intersects
00109   // a cell at index 50 of array 1. This method is equivalent to 
00110   // GetOutput(i)->GetFieldData()->GetArray("ContactCells")
00111     vtkIdTypeArray *GetContactCells(int i);
00112 
00113   // Description:
00114   // Get the output with the points where the contacting cells intersect. This method is
00115   // is equivalent to GetOutputPort(2)/GetOutput(2) 
00116   vtkAlgorithmOutput *GetContactsOutputPort() {return this->GetOutputPort(2);}
00117   vtkPolyData *GetContactsOutput() {return this->GetOutput(2);}
00118 
00119   // Description:
00120   // Specify the transform object used to transform models. Alternatively, matrices
00121   // can be set instead.
00122   void SetTransform(int i, vtkLinearTransform *transform);
00123   vtkLinearTransform *GetTransform(int i) {return this->Transform[i];}
00124   
00125   // Description:
00126   // Specify the matrix object used to transform models.
00127   void SetMatrix(int i, vtkMatrix4x4 *matrix);
00128   vtkMatrix4x4 *GetMatrix(int i);
00129   
00130   //Description:
00131   // Set and Get the obb tolerance (absolute value, in world coords). Default is 0.001
00132   vtkSetMacro(BoxTolerance, float);
00133   vtkGetMacro(BoxTolerance, float);
00134 
00135   //Description:
00136   // Set and Get the cell tolerance (squared value). Default is 0.0
00137   vtkSetMacro(CellTolerance, double);
00138   vtkGetMacro(CellTolerance, double);
00139   
00140   //Description:
00141   // Set and Get the the flag to visualize the contact cells. If set the contacting cells
00142   // will be coloured from red through to blue, with collisions first determined coloured red.
00143   vtkSetMacro(GenerateScalars, int);
00144   vtkGetMacro(GenerateScalars, int);
00145   vtkBooleanMacro(GenerateScalars,int);
00146   
00147   //Description:
00148   // Get the number of contacting cell pairs
00149   int GetNumberOfContacts() 
00150     {return this->GetOutput(0)->GetFieldData()->GetArray("ContactCells")->GetNumberOfTuples();}
00151   
00152   //Description:
00153   // Get the number of box tests
00154   vtkGetMacro(NumberOfBoxTests, int); 
00155     
00156   //Description:
00157   // Set and Get the number of cells in each OBB. Default is 2
00158   vtkSetMacro(NumberOfCellsPerBucket, int);
00159   vtkGetMacro(NumberOfCellsPerBucket, int);
00160   
00161   //Description:
00162   // Set and Get the opacity of the polydata output when a collision takes place.
00163   // Default is 1.0
00164   vtkSetClampMacro(Opacity, float, 0.0, 1.0);
00165   vtkGetMacro(Opacity, float);
00166 
00167   // Description:
00168   // Return the MTime also considering the transform.
00169   unsigned long GetMTime();
00170 
00171 protected:
00172   vtkCollisionDetectionFilter();
00173   ~vtkCollisionDetectionFilter();
00174 
00175   // Usual data generation method
00176   virtual int RequestData(vtkInformation *, vtkInformationVector **, vtkInformationVector *);
00177   
00178   vtkOBBTree *tree0;
00179   vtkOBBTree *tree1;
00180 
00181   vtkLinearTransform *Transform[2];
00182   vtkMatrix4x4 *Matrix[2];
00183   
00184   int NumberOfBoxTests;
00185   
00186   int NumberOfCellsPerBucket;
00187   
00188   int GenerateScalars;
00189   
00190   float BoxTolerance;
00191   float CellTolerance;
00192   float Opacity;
00193   
00194   int CollisionMode;
00195 
00196 private:  
00197 
00198   vtkCollisionDetectionFilter(const vtkCollisionDetectionFilter&);  // Not implemented.
00199   void operator=(const vtkCollisionDetectionFilter&);  // Not implemented.
00200 };
00201 
00202 //BTX
00203 
00204 inline const char *vtkCollisionDetectionFilter::GetCollisionModeAsString(void)
00205 {
00206   if ( this->CollisionMode == VTK_ALL_CONTACTS )
00207     {
00208     return (char *)"AllContacts";
00209     }
00210   else if (this->CollisionMode == VTK_FIRST_CONTACT)
00211     {
00212     return (char *)"FirstContact";
00213     }
00214   else
00215     {
00216     return (char *)"HalfContacts";
00217     }
00218 }
00219 
00220 //ETX
00221 #endif
